answers.answer: Hi,It will help us to know which antidepressant your uncle is taking. Xanax will not cause these symptoms.There is a possibility of peripheral neuropathy casing these cold sensations, causes of which include thyroid dysfunction, diabetes, vitamin B 12 deficiency and alcohol induced peripheral neuropathy.This requires further evaluation. Please ask him to get an appointment with his GP and get a clinical exam done.Thanks

question: Concerned about my uncle who has been having problems with his head feeling very cold that he has to wear a stocking cap in warm weather (at home) and has bad headaches that accompany this.  He has had a history of psychogical problems and is taking anti-depressants and xanax.  My question is, could this medication cause him to have this problem.  He has been to several doctors and not one of them have found where this problem is coming from.  Would appreciate any information that might be helpful because it just seems that he has given up and it is taking a toll on his marriage.  Has anyone heard of these symptons or has acutally had them?
title: Feeling coldness in head with headache
